intro: Psilochenia bakeri subsp. idahoensis, commonly known as the Idaho psilochenia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Idaho. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinct, often fragrant scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
